St. Helens, 21 Sep., 1859.

Last Mailday I did not write to you. My George returned after several days absence & we had so much to tell each other; now he sits beside me & writes also. — Mr. Danbin was with us yesterday, he says in the summer I must come for three month to them, he will bring Mrs. Danbin here soon. I work daily in the Garden & things begin to look nice, the Strawberrys are full of blossums & the Gooseberrys as full as can be. Georgie helps me with all his might & with his little w-barrow he carts all the weeds out of the Garden for me. Yesterday he said "Papa & Mama are eating weeds", we had salad. — Yesterday when Elisabeth brought in his dinner, he said "I do not want it", who shall I give it to then? "Give it to Bertha Wehl". I could tell you much more about him only I am afraid you will think me quite silly about my boy. — —
